comments:
Build id: I20051018-0932

After migrating to latest integration build install, first restart of my
workspace did trigger a crash recovery and some exceptions (see below).
My workspace had been correctly exited prior to the migration, so the crash
recovery is wrong.

Previously my workspace was running on eclipse-SDK-I20051012-1200
Subsequent restart did not exhibit the same behavior, and was fine.

I have also seen crash recoveries occurring in my workspace when they should
not. This typically happens when something modifies the workspace after save has
finished but before the resources plugin's stop() method is called. I think a
debug flag is needed to help track down these cases.

I'm seeing this on linux and windows.

Paul, your bug is different. Can you enter a new bug against JDT UI with that stack trace? In your case two JDT threads are both trying to load classes at the same time (InitializeAfterLoadJob and the reconciler).

Ooops, OK, I've moved my errors to bug 131701

PW

There are two unrelated things in this bug report - the crash recovery notice, and the exception on startup.  I haven't seen that generated exception on startup in awhile, so I'm going to mark this as a dup of bug 118420 that deals with the crash recovery notice.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 118420 ***
